org.gbif.cli

Class BaseCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.cli.Command
      • org.gbif.cli.BaseCommand
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServiceCommand

    public abstract class BaseCommand
extends Command
    This base command can be used for all Commands that want to have their parameters validated and who want to allow specifying configuration data in a JSON or YAML file.

    JSR 303 annotations can be used for validation as well as the built-in methods from JCommander.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigurationObject

        protected abstract Object getConfigurationObject()
        The object returned by this method will be populated from the JSON or YAML files specified using the --conf command line parameter. The files given in this way will be applied in the order they appeared on the command line so later files might overwrite earlier ones.

        This can be the same object as the one returned from getParameterObject() in which case command line parameters override options from the files.

      • getParameterObject

        protected Object getParameterObject()
        This is the object which has JCommander annotations and will be populated from the command line arguments.

        This can be the same object as the one returned from getConfigurationObject()} in which case command line parameters override options from the files. The default implementation defers to getConfigurationObject().

      • doRun

        protected abstract void doRun()
        This method will be called when the generic parameters have been handled and configuration and parameter objects have been populated.

      • getUsage

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<String> getUsage()
        Description copied from class: Command
        Optionally returns a string describing the usage of this command.
        Specified by:
        getUsage in class Command
        Returns:
        Optional.absent() if this command doesn't take any further parameters otherwise a string describing the parameters

      • run

        public final void run(String... arguments)
        Description copied from class: Command
        This is the main entry point into this command.
        Specified by:
        run in class Command
        Parameters:
        arguments - all arguments that are relevant for this command. This does not include the command name or any other arguments that the Application itself might have parsed
